title: Team member invitations to sandboxed teams are not invalidated consistently

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
hello today i found a Bug about Auth in Send invitation to member to join the team ,, so if Now 
The Victim Send invition to Another Victim Account to join the team as a Manager,, the link of the invitation is will Be Valid For Many Many Many time to Accept the invtiation from Another Accounts in H1 so let's say example :
A send invtation emai to B

the other Acconts could access to the Account and open it and Accept the invtiation Without invtiet them !!!

the invetion url :https://hackerone.com/invitations/54a725ee8c5b8d7c1225e8b486716145

the poc :
http://youtu.be/dL7FOBCssFE

activities.message:
I'm not able to reproduce the issue you are suggesting. After accepting an invitation we invalidate the invitation and thus you shouldn't be able to accept the invitation again. Your POC video is also a bit hard to follow.

Can you provide a written POC that takes us step by step through your process? The better the POC is written, the easier it will make it for us to reproduce this.
activities.markdown_message:
I'm not able to reproduce the issue you are suggesting. After accepting an invitation we invalidate the invitation and thus you shouldn't be able to accept the invitation again. Your POC video is also a bit hard to follow.

Can you provide a written POC that takes us step by step through your process? The better the POC is written, the easier it will make it for us to reproduce this.

activities.message:
okay steps :

1-create 3 Account ,, 2 For victims ,, and 1 for Attacker
2-from the first victim account send it to email of Victim 
3-second Victim reviced the invitation Via his Email ,, copy the invietion Url and open it From the 
third account(Attacker Account) .
4-the attacker account When will Click Accept invitation wil See this message "PAGE NOT FOUND"
and this Message is "the confirmation to Be part of the team "
5-the attacker Navigate to  https://hackerone.com/settings/teams ,, and will noticed the Team of victim in his list  
6- Now the invitation url open it from the Second victim Account How is Reviced the message of invitation before ,, and accept the investion and will be part of the team and the conformation is Approvel !

7- so no the link of invitation is will not expire and he can open the link from other's accounts and will notcied he could accept the invition and when he accept invitation will be part of the team

in the finish i hope to be understand the steps 

mazen gamal

activities.message:
> the attacker account When will Click Accept invitation wil See this message "PAGE NOT FOUND"
and this Message is "the confirmation to Be part of the team "

Your POC seems to be flawed. When trying to do this, it already invalidated the invitation because the "attacker" accepted the invitation in step 3. I also do not encounter a 404 - Page Not Found error.

Furthermore is the invitation token not limited to a specific email address (by design). It's possible to accept an invitation by creating an account with a different email address than the invitation was originally sent to.
activities.markdown_message:
the attacker account When will Click Accept invitation wil See this message "PAGE NOT FOUND"
and this Message is "the confirmation to Be part of the team "

Your POC seems to be flawed. When trying to do this, it already invalidated the invitation because the "attacker" accepted the invitation in step 3. I also do not encounter a 404 - Page Not Found error.

Furthermore is the invitation token not limited to a specific email address (by design). It's possible to accept an invitation by creating an account with a different email address than the invitation was originally sent to.

activities.message:
I just tried this (with the link you provided), but to no avail. When I joined the team successfully and open the invitation again, it will respond with a 404 error – which means the invitation is immediately expired. When I tried to join the team again with a different account, it still shows a 404 error.

Because I was unable to reproduce this, I'm closing this as N/A.
activities.markdown_message:
I just tried this (with the link you provided), but to no avail. When I joined the team successfully and open the invitation again, it will respond with a 404 error – which means the invitation is immediately expired. When I tried to join the team again with a different account, it still shows a 404 error.

Because I was unable to reproduce this, I'm closing this as N/A.

activities.message: @mazengamal I'm sorry but 4 of our team members tried to reproduce this bug report in the steps that you described, and in all cases the invitation was expired. We even have automated tests covering this case, so unless you can provide us with a POC that we can reproduce, there is no way that we can triage this bug.
activities.markdown_message: @mazengamal I'm sorry but 4 of our team members tried to reproduce this bug report in the steps that you described, and in all cases the invitation was expired. We even have automated tests covering this case, so unless you can provide us with a POC that we can reproduce, there is no way that we can triage this bug.

activities.message: This is not going to work @mazengamal. Out of goodwill I rejected the above invitation and, to no surprise, the invitation was directly invalidated – again. And it will keep doing that because me and my colleagues already explained too many times everything works like expected. There just is no security issue here.
activities.markdown_message: This is not going to work @mazengamal. Out of goodwill I rejected the above invitation and, to no surprise, the invitation was directly invalidated – again. And it will keep doing that because me and my colleagues already explained too many times everything works like expected. There just is no security issue here.

activities.message:
Hi @mazengamal,

After a long period of time we were finally able to reproduce this. Although the security implications are minimal or non-existing, we have decided that we are going to fix this issue so other users won't run into this problem.
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message: @mazengamal the described situation seems highly unlikely as the team manager likely won't invite someone who can't be trusted. If so, there are much worse things team members could do other than inviting more people.
activities.markdown_message: @mazengamal the described situation seems highly unlikely as the team manager likely won't invite someone who can't be trusted. If so, there are much worse things team members could do other than inviting more people.

activities.message: Thanks for your help tracking this down. Some reasoning on the decision to award the minimum here: In general, the security implications of this category of issue aren't very severe as the impact is limited to a malicious team member. Furthermore, the underlying root cause here only existed under unusual circumstances with a `sandboxed` team (specifically, it occurred when `demo-researcher` was rate limited when creating a new report for the invited team member), but you had no way to identify that criteria.  This report still helped us harden some exception handling related to invitation invalidation so we're awarding a bounty here. Thanks again mazen!
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for your help tracking this down. Some reasoning on the decision to award the minimum here: In general, the security implications of this category of issue aren't very severe as the impact is limited to a malicious team member. Furthermore, the underlying root cause here only existed under unusual circumstances with a sandboxed team (specifically, it occurred when demo-researcher was rate limited when creating a new report for the invited team member), but you had no way to identify that criteria. This report still helped us harden some exception handling related to invitation invalidation so we're awarding a bounty here. Thanks again mazen!

additional_data.old_title: Team member invitations don't get invalidated after use
additional_data.new_title: Team member invitations to sandboxed teams are not invalidated consistently

activities.message:
@mazengamal -- Thanks for your interest in our HackerOne hoodies. In the past, we've given out hoodies platform-wide top researchers.
Your best bet for getting a hoodie in the future would be to keep hacking and stay active on the platform!
